groovyx.gaelyk
[Groovy] Class GaelykCategory

java.lang.Object
  groovyx.gaelyk.GaelykCategoryBase
      groovyx.gaelyk.GaelykCategory

class GaelykCategory
extends GaelykCategoryBase

Category methods decorating the Google App Engine SDK classes adding new shortcut methods to simplify the usage of the SDK from within Groovy servlets and templates.

Authors:
Guillaume Laforge
Scott Murphy

static Object asType(String self, Class clazz)

Converter method for converting strings into various GAE specific types 


  "foo@bar.com" as Email
  "http://www.google.com" as Link
  "+3361234543" as PhoneNumber
  "50 avenue de la Madeleine, Paris" as PostalAddress
  "groovy" as DatastoreCategory
  "32" as Rating
  "long text" as Text
  "foobar" as BlobKey
  "foo@gmail.com" as JID
  "agR0ZXN0cg8LEgdwZXJzb25zIgJtZQw" as Key

static Object asType(List list, Class clazz)

Converter method for converting a pair of numbers (in a list) into a GeoPt instance: 


  [45.32, 54.54f] as GeoPt
Or to convert a list of elements into a Key, avoiding the usage of KeyFactory.createKey(): 

  [parentKey, 'address', 333] as Key
  [parentKey, 'address', 'name'] as Key
  ['address', 444] as Key
  ['address', 'name'] as Key

static Object asType(IntRange range, Class byteRangeClass)

Converter method for converting an int range to a blobstore ByteRange: 


     300..400 as ByteRange
Note that Groovy already allowed: [300, 400] as ByteRange.

Property Detail

DEFAULT_FETCH_OPTIONS

static final def DEFAULT_FETCH_OPTIONS

 
Method Detail

add

static TaskHandle add(Queue selfQueue, Map params)
Add a new task on the queue using a map for holding the task attributes instead of a TaskOptions builder object.

Allowed keys are:

  • countdownMillis
  • etaMillis
  • headers (a map of key/value pairs)
  • method (can be 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE', 'HEAD' or an enum of TaskOptions.Method)
  • params (a map of key/value parameters)
  • payload
  • taskName
  • url
Parameters:
params - the map of task attributes
Returns:
a TaskHandle instance

add

static AddResponse add(Index index, Closure closure)
Add a new document to the index. 

     index.add {
         document(id: "1234", locale: US, rank: 3) {
             title text: "Big bad wolf", locale: ENGLISH
             published date: new Date()
             numberOfCopies number: 35
             summary html: "
super story
", locale: ENGLISH
             description text: "a book for children"
             category atom: "children"
             keyword text: "wolf"
             keyword text: "red hook"
         }
     }
The named arguments are restricted to id, locale and rank. The calls inside the closure correspond to the field name, its type thanks to a named argument of the form type: value, and optionally a locale. You can have several times the same field name, for multi-valued fields.
Parameters:
index - the index to which to add the documents
closure - the closure defining the documents to be added to the index
Returns:
an instance of AddResponse

asBoolean

static boolean asBoolean(CapabilityStatus capabilityStatus)
Coerces a capability status into a boolean. This mechanism is used by the "Groovy Truth".
Returns:
true if the capability status is ENABLED, otherwise false.

asType

static Object asType(Future self, Class clazz)
Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion. You can use this type coercion mechanism to coerce POJOs/POGOs and datastore Entities. The Future kind will be the simple name of the POJO/POGO (same approach as Objectify). So with this mechanism, you can do: 

  class Person { String name, int age }

  def e = key.asyncGet()

  def p = e as Person

  assert e.name == p.name
  assert e.age == p.age
Returns:
an instance of a POJO/POGO to coerce into

asType

static Object asType(String self, Class clazz)
Converter method for converting strings into various GAE specific types 

  "foo@bar.com" as Email
  "http://www.google.com" as Link
  "+3361234543" as PhoneNumber
  "50 avenue de la Madeleine, Paris" as PostalAddress
  "groovy" as DatastoreCategory
  "32" as Rating
  "long text" as Text
  "foobar" as BlobKey
  "foo@gmail.com" as JID
  "agR0ZXN0cg8LEgdwZXJzb25zIgJtZQw" as Key

asType

static String asType(Key self, Class clazz)
Convert a Key into its encoded String representation, using the underlying KeyFactory.keyToString() conversion method.
Parameters:
self - the key
clazz - the String class
Returns:
the encoded string representation of the key

asType

static Object asType(Object self, Class clazz)
Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion. You can use this type coercion mechanism to coerce POJOs/POGOs and datastore Entities. The Entity kind will be the simple name of the POJO/POGO (same approach as Objectify). So with this mechanism, you can do: 

  class Person { String name, int age }

  def p = new Person(name: "Guillaume", age: 33)
  def e = p as Entity

  assert p.name == e.name
  assert p.age == e.age
Returns:
an instance of Entity

asType

static Object asType(Entity self, Class clazz)
Gaelyk supports a simplistic object/entity mapping, thanks to type coercion. You can use this type coercion mechanism to coerce POJOs/POGOs and datastore Entities. The Entity kind will be the simple name of the POJO/POGO (same approach as Objectify). So with this mechanism, you can do: 

  class Person { String name, int age }

  def e = new Entity("Person")
  e.name = "Guillaume"
  e.age = 33

  def p = e as Person

  assert e.name == p.name
  assert e.age == p.age
Returns:
an instance of a POJO/POGO to coerce into

asType

static Link asType(URL self, Class linkClass)
Converter method for converting a URL into a Link instance 

  new URL("http://gaelyk.appspot.com") as Link

asType

static Object asType(Integer self, Class ratingClass)
Converter method for converting an integer into a Rating instance 

  32 as Rating

asType

static Object asType(byte[] self, Class blobClass)
Converter method for converting a byte array into a Blob or ShortBlob instance 

  "some byte".getBytes() as Blob
  "some byte".getBytes() as ShortBlob

asType

static Object asType(List list, Class clazz)
Converter method for converting a pair of numbers (in a list) into a GeoPt instance: 

  [45.32, 54.54f] as GeoPt
Or to convert a list of elements into a Key, avoiding the usage of KeyFactory.createKey(): 

  [parentKey, 'address', 333] as Key
  [parentKey, 'address', 'name'] as Key
  ['address', 444] as Key
  ['address', 'name'] as Key

asType

static Object asType(IntRange range, Class byteRangeClass)
Converter method for converting an int range to a blobstore ByteRange: 

     300..400 as ByteRange
Note that Groovy already allowed: [300, 400] as ByteRange.
Parameters:
range - the range to convert
byteRangeClass - the class of the byte range
Returns:
a ByteRange instance

a cropped image

getHeaders

static Map getHeaders(HttpServletResponse response)
Adds a fake getHeaders() method to HttpServletResponse. It allows the similar subscript notation syntax of request, but for setting or overriding a header on the response (ie. calling response.setHeader()). It also allows the leftShift notation for adding a header to the response (ie. calling response.addHeader(). 

  // sets or overrides the header 'a'
  response.headers['a'] == 'b'

  // adds an additional value to an existing header
  // or sets a first value for a non-existant header
  response.headers['a'] << 'b'
Parameters:
response
Returns:
a custom map on which you can use the subscript notation to add headers

getHeadersMap

static Map getHeadersMap(HTTPResponse response)
Returns:
a convenient Map of HTTP Headers from the response

getServingUrl

static String getServingUrl(BlobKey blobKey, Map options)
Obtains a URL that can serve the image stored as a blob dynamically. Note: getServingUrl can be time consuming so this should only be done once per blobkey and the result should be stored for future use. 

 image.url = blobKey.getServingUrl(retry: 2, onRetry: { ex, i ->
    // do something... log exception? Thread.sleep(1000*i) ?
    true // must return true in order to continue next retry
 }, onFail: { ex -> // do something
 })
Parameters:
selfKey - the key
a - Map of options retries - the number of times to retry upon failure. onRetry - a closure that is called upon each retry attempt. Takes 2 parameters: 1. causing exception 2. # retries Closure must return true in order to continue otherwise no more retries will be attempted and onFail will be returned. If no onFail is specified, null will be returned as the URL. onFail - a closure that is called if serving url could not be retrieved successfully. Takes 1 parameter: causing exception Note: if you don't pass an onFail closure, the underlying exception will propagate out otherwise the result of onFail will be returned as the URL.
Returns:
a URL that can serve the image dynamically.

the size of the blob

leftShift

static Entity leftShift(Entity entity, Map params)
Set the Entity properties with the key / value pairs of the map, using the leftshift operator as follows: entity << params

static Future leftShift(Future future, Map params)

leftShift

static TaskHandle leftShift(Queue selfQueue, Map params)
Add a new task on the queue using a map for holding the task attributes instead of a TaskOptions builder object. This method adds a << operator on the Queue for adding new tasks to it.

Allowed keys are:

  • countdownMillis
  • etaMillis
  • headers (a map of key/value pairs)
  • method (can be 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', 'DELETE', 'HEAD' or an enum of TaskOptions.Method)
  • params (a map of key/value parameters)
  • payload
  • taskName
  • url
Parameters:
params - the map of task attributes
Returns:
a TaskHandle instance

leftShift

static CompositeTransform leftShift(CompositeTransform leftTransform, Transform rightTransform)
Use the leftShift operator, <<, to concatenate a transform to the composite transform. 

 def cropTransform = ...
 def rotateTransform = ...

 croptTransform << rotateTransform
Parameters:
leftTransform - a transform
rightTransform - another transform
Returns:
a composite transform

memoize

static Closure memoize(MemcacheService memcache, Closure closure)
Memoize a closure invocation in memcache. Closure call result are stored in memcache, retaining the closure hashCode and the argument values as key. The results are kept in memcache only up to the 30 seconds request time limit of Google App Engine. 

 def countEntities = memcache.memoize { String kind -> datastore.prepare( new Query(kind) ).countEntities() }
 def totalPhotos = countEntities('photos')
Parameters:
closure - the closure to memoize
Returns:
a memoized closure

of

static void of(Class nm, String ns, Closure c)
Use a namespace in the context of the excution of the closure. This method will save the original namespace and restore it afterwards. 

 namespace.of('test') { ... }
Parameters:
nm - NamespaceManager class
ns - the name of the namespace to use
c - the code to execute under that namespace

groovy.lang.MissingPropertyException when the key doesn't correspond to a property of the MailService.Message class.

send

static SendResponse send(XMPPService xmppService, Map msgAttr)
Send an XMPP/Jabber message with the XMPP service using a map of attributes to build the message.

Possible attributes are:

  • from: the sender Jabber ID represented as a String
  • to: a String or a list of String representing recepients' Jabber IDs
  • type: an instance of the MessageType enum, or a String representation ('CHAT', 'ERROR', 'GROUPCHAT', 'HEADLINE', 'NORMAL')
  • body: a String representing the raw text to send
  • xml: a closure representing the XML you want to send (serialized using StreamingMarkupBuilder)
Parameters:
msgAttr - a map of attributes as described
Returns:
an intance of SendResponse

Send a message through the Channel service
Parameters:
clientId - the client ID
message - the message to send

sendInvitation

static void sendInvitation(XMPPService xmppService, String jabberIdTo, String jabberIdFrom)
Send a chat invitation to a Jabber ID from another Jabber ID.
Parameters:
jabberIdTo - the Jabber ID to invite
jabberIdFrom - the Jabber ID to use to send the invitation request

sendToAdmins

static void sendToAdmins(MailService mailService, Map m)
Additional sendToAdmins() method for sending emails to the application admins. This method is taking a map as parameter. The map can contain the normal properties of the MailService.Message class.
throws:
groovy.lang.MissingPropertyException when the key doesn't correspond to a property of the MailService.Message class.

static Image transform(Image selfImage, Closure c)

  bytes.image.transform {
      resize 100, 100
      crop 0.1, 0.1, 0.9, 0.9
      flip horizontal
      flip vertical
      rotate 90
      feeling lucky
  }
Parameters:
selfImage - the image to transform
c - the closure containg the various transform steps
Returns:
a transformed image

withInputStream

static AppEngineFile withInputStream(AppEngineFile file, Map options = [:], Closure closure)
Method creating a buffered input stream for the AppEngineFile, read binary content from it, and closes it when done. 

  def file = files.fromPath(someStringPath)

  // with default options
  file.withInputStream { stream ->
      // read from the buffered input stream
  }

  // with specific options:
  file.withInputStream(locked: true) { stream ->
      // read from the buffered input stream
  }
Parameters:
file - the AppEngineFile to read from
options - an optional map containing one possible key: locked (a boolean, if you want to acquire a lock on the file -- false by default),
closure - the closure with the input stream as parameter
Returns:
the original file, for chaining purpose

withOutputStream

static AppEngineFile withOutputStream(AppEngineFile file, Map options = [:], Closure closure)
Method creating an output stream for the AppEngineFile, writing bynary content to it, and closes it when done. 

  def file = files.createNewBlobFile("text/plain", "hello.txt")

  // with default options
  file.withOutputStream { stream ->
      stream << "some content".bytes
  }

  // with specific options:
  file.withOutputStream(locked: true, finalize: false) { writer ->
      stream << "some content".bytes
  }
Parameters:
file - the AppEngineFile to write to
options - an optional map containing two possible keys: locked (a boolean, if you want to acquire a write lock on the file -- false by default), finalize (a boolean, if you want to close the file definitively -- false by default).
closure - the closure with the output stream as parameter
Returns:
the original file, for chaining purpose

withReader

static Object withReader(BlobKey selfKey, String encoding, Closure c)
Creates a (buffered) Reader over the blob with a specified encoding. The reader is passed as parameter of the closure. This methods takes care of properly opening and closing the reader and underlying stream. You can use this method as follows: 

 blobKey.withReader("UTF-8") { reader -> ... }
Parameters:
selfKey - a BlobKey
encoding - the encoding used to read from the stream (UTF-8, etc.)
c - the closure to execute, passing in the stream as parameter of the closure
Returns:
the return value of the closure execution

withReader

static Object withReader(BlobKey selfKey, Closure c)
Creates a (buffered) Reader over the blob using UTF-8 as default encoding. The reader is passed as parameter of the closure. This methods takes care of properly opening and closing the reader and underlying stream. You can use this method as follows: 

  blobKey.withReader { reader -> ... }
Parameters:
selfKey - a BlobKey
encoding - the encoding used to read from the stream (UTF-8, etc.)
c - the closure to execute, passing in the stream as parameter of the closure
Returns:
the return value of the closure execution

withReader

static AppEngineFile withReader(AppEngineFile file, Map options = [:], Closure closure)
Method creating a reader for the AppEngineFile, read textual content from it, and closes it when done. 

  def file = files.fromPath(someStringPath)

  // with default options
  file.withReader { reader ->
      log.info reader.text
  }

  // with specific options:
  file.withReader(encoding: "US-ASCII", locked: true) { reader ->
      log.info reader.text
  }
Parameters:
file - the AppEngineFile to read from
options - an optional map containing two possible keys: encoding (a String, the encoding to be used for the reader -- UTF8 by default), locked (a boolean, if you want to acquire a lock on the file -- false by default),
closure - the closure with the reader as parameter
Returns:
the original file, for chaining purpose

withStream

static Object withStream(BlobKey selfKey, Closure c)
Creates an InputStream over the blob. The stream is passed as parameter of the closure. This methods takes care of properly opening and closing the stream. You can use this method as follows: 

 blobKey.withStream { inputstream -> ... }
Parameters:
selfKey - a BlobKey
c - the closure to execute, passing in the stream as parameter of the closure
Returns:
the return value of the closure execution

withTransaction

static Transaction withTransaction(DatastoreService service, Closure c)
With this method, transaction handling is done transparently. The transaction is committed if the closure executed properly. The transaction is rollbacked if anything went wrong. You can use this method as follows: datastore.withTransaction { transaction -> // do something in that transaction }

withTransaction

static Future withTransaction(AsyncDatastoreService service, Closure c)
With this method, transaction handling is done transparently. The transaction is committed if the closure executed properly. The transaction is rollbacked if anything went wrong. You can use this method as follows: datastore.async.withTransaction { transactionFuture -> // do something in that transaction }

withTransactionCommitAsync

static Future withTransactionCommitAsync(AsyncDatastoreService service, Closure c)
With this method, transaction handling is done transparently. The transaction is asynchronously committed if the closure executed properly. The transaction is rollbacked if anything went wrong. You can use this method as follows: datastore.async.withTransactionCommitAsync { transactionFuture -> // do something in that transaction }
Returns:
Future calling .get() blocks until all oustanding async calls have completed

withWriter

static AppEngineFile withWriter(AppEngineFile file, Map options = [:], Closure closure)
Method creating a writer for the AppEngineFile, writing textual content to it, and closes it when done. 

  def file = files.createNewBlobFile("text/plain", "hello.txt")

  // with default options
  file.withWriter { writer ->
      writer << "some content"
  }

  // with specific options:
  file.withWriter(encoding: "US-ASCII", locked: true, finalize: false) { writer ->
      writer << "some content
  }
Parameters:
file - the AppEngineFile to write to
options - an optional map containing three possible keys: encoding (a String, the encoding to be used for the writer -- UTF8 by default), locked (a boolean, if you want to acquire a write lock on the file -- false by default), finalize (a boolean, if you want to close the file definitively -- false by default).
closure - the closure with the writer as parameter
Returns:
the original file, for chaining purpose
